intro: Minkelersia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Minkelersia has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and can thrive in temperate climates.
